case_vignette: A 33-year-old woman comes to the physician because of vision impairment in her right eye for the past 2 weeks. During this period, she was unable to distinguish colors with her right eye. She also reports pain with eye movement. She has no double vision. She occasionally has headaches that are relieved by ibuprofen. One year ago, she had a similar episode that affected her left eye and resolved spontaneously. She has no history of serious illness. She works at a library and enjoys reading, even in poor lighting conditions. Her vital signs are within normal limits. The pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light and accommodation. Without correction, visual acuity is 20/50 in the left eye, and 20/100 in the right eye. With spectacles, the visual acuity is 20/20 in the left eye and 20/100 in the right eye. Slit lamp examination shows no abnormalities. A CT scan of the head shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing vision impairment in my right eye for the past 2 weeks and it's difficult to distinguish colors with that eye. There's also pain when moving the eye.
Have you experienced any other neurological symptoms like weakness, numbness, or tingling in your limbs?
No, I haven't experienced any weakness, numbness, or tingling in my limbs.
Do you have any history of autoimmune diseases or any other chronic illnesses?
No, I have no history of autoimmune diseases or any other serious illnesses.
Has anyone in your family had similar vision problems or been diagnosed with neurological or autoimmune disorders?
No, there is no family history of similar vision problems or neurological or autoimmune disorders.
Are you currently on any medications or have you started any new medications recently?
No, I am not on any medications and haven't started any new medications recently.
Final Diagnosis: Optic Neuritis.
